etymology.description: 亻 ‘person’ + 又 ‘hand’ or 亻 ‘person’ + 寸 ‘hand’: to deliver, to give to someone.
etymology.interpretation: A person 亻 interacts with a hand (又/寸), evoking the act of handing something over. The components together suggest giving or paying something to another person.

examples.chinese: 请把钥匙付给他(請把鑰匙付給他)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ yàoshi fù gěi tā.
examples.english: Please hand the key to him.

examples.chinese: 他们按时付房租(他們按時付房租)。
examples.english: They pay the rent on time.
